alert.note: Alert for Decatur (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 12:43PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN JACKSON...NORTHWESTERN GULF...BAY AND CALHOUN COUNTIES IN THE PANHANDLE OF FLORIDA... NORTHWESTERN WAKULLA AND GADSDEN COUNTIES IN BIG BEND FLORIDA... SOUTHEASTERN WALTON COUNTY IN THE PANHANDLE OF FLORIDA...NORTHERN LIBERTY COUNTY IN BIG BEND FLORIDA...WASHINGTON COUNTY IN THE PANHANDLE OF FLORIDA...SOUTHWESTERN LEON COUNTY IN BIG BEND FLORIDA AND SOUTHWESTERN DECATUR COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN GEORGIA THROUGH 115 PM EDT/1215 PM CDT/... At 1243 PM EDT/1143 AM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Midway to near Blountstown to near Panama City Beach. Movement was northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Tallahassee, Panama City, Lynn Haven, Panama City Beach, Callaway, Vernon, Quincy, Blountstown, Marianna, Midway, Havana, Springfield, Hiland Park, Chattahoochee, Greensboro, Tyndall Air Force Base, Orange, Bradford, Live Oak, and Parker. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
